title: Oculus takes aim at mainstream with inexpensive gear, video

Nick Ut Oculus takes aim at mainstream with inexpensive gear, video 
The Samsung Gear VR on display during the Oculus 2 conference in Los Angeles, Thursday, Sept. 24, 2015. Samsung says the new virtual reality headset will be 22 percent lighter and, at $99, half the price of its previous model. The Korean electronics company hopes the changes to the Gear VR, which ships in November, will help push virtual reality into the mainstream. LOS ANGELES (AP) — Virtual reality is taking a few steps closer to the mainstream with Samsung unveiling a headset that brings the technology to its latest smartphones at half the price of its previous model, Facebook launching support for 360-degree video, and online video services like Netflix and Hulu jumping into the format.
